<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of run_usock:
```c
static void *
run_usock (void *cls)
{
  struct WsData *ws = cls;
  struct MHD_UpgradeResponseHandle *urh = ws->urh;
  unsigned char buf[2048];
  unsigned char *msg;
  char *text;
  ssize_t got;
  int type;
  int i;

  make_blocking (ws->sock);
  while (1)
  {
    got = recv (ws->sock, (void *) buf, sizeof (buf), 0);
    if (0 >= got)
    {
      break;
    }
    msg = ws_receive_frame (buf, &got, &type);
    if (NULL == msg)
    {
      break;
    }
    if (type == WS_OPCODE_TEXT_FRAME)
    {
      ssize_t sent;
      int buf_size;
      buf_size = snprintf (NULL, 0, "User#%d: %s", (int) ws->sock, msg);
      if (0 < buf_size)
      {
        text = malloc ((size_t) buf_size + 1);
        if (NULL != text)
        {
          if (snprintf (text, (size_t) buf_size + 1,
                        "User#%d: %s", (int) ws->sock, msg) == buf_size)
            sent = ws_send_frame (ws->sock, text, (size_t) buf_size);
          else
            sent = -1;
          free (text);
        }
        else
          sent = -1;
      }
      else
        sent = -1;
      free (msg);
      if (-1 == sent)
      {
        break;
      }
    }
    else
    {
      if (type == WS_OPCODE_CON_CLOSE_FRAME)
      {
        free (msg);
        break;
      }
    }
  }
  if (0 != pthread_mutex_lock (&MUTEX))
    abort ();
  for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++)
  {
    if (CLIENT_SOCKS[i] == ws->sock)
    {
      CLIENT_SOCKS[i] = MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
      break;
    }
  }
  if (0 != pthread_mutex_unlock (&MUTEX))
    abort ();
  free (ws);
  MHD_upgrade_action (urh, MHD_UPGRADE_ACTION_CLOSE);
  return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
msg = ws_receive_frame (buf, &got, &type);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call passes the local buffer 'buf' (unsigned char[]) to ws_receive_frame. If ws_receive_frame only reads from the buffer (i.e. does not modify it) then its parameter should be declared as const unsigned char * (and similarly the returned 'msg' should be a pointer to const data if it is only read). Having non-const pointer types in the declaration/usage when the data is not modified violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. (Concretely: if ws_receive_frame is declared to accept/return unsigned char * rather than const-qualified pointers while it does not write to the data, that is a Rule 8.13 violation.)
